abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory. The key lessons learned include: a)
            Desirable macro-economic policy change can sometimes
            adversely impact on the stated objectives of ongoing Bank
            operations designed under a sub-optimal policy framework. b)
            The Bank's involvement at the subsector level can be a
            desirable complement to macro-economic policy dialog. c) The
            project demonstrates that not only the borrowers, but the
            Bank also needs to be responsive to market forces. Two years
            before the terms of Bank lending were altered from currency
            pool to single currency loans, at the borrower's
            option, this project exhibited such a requirement. d) The
            collaboration with Swiss Agency for Development and
            Cooperation was not as smooth as it could have been. If an
            explicit project launch workshop was conducted early on, at
            which respective roles were clearly defined and a framework
            for project supervision and monitoring put in place,
            collaboration with cofinancier could have been more amicable
            and effective. e) Early involvement of the implementing
            agencies with the project preparation activity would reduce
            time required to bring the implementation unit up to speed
            with project design and avoid gestation lags. f) The scope
            of pilot scale projects should include a design for
            evaluation of the pilot-scale activity.
